course.subject: MATH
course.name: Nonparametric Statistics
course.description: The sign test; Wilcoxon signed rank test; Wilcoxon rank-sum test; Kruskal-Wallis test; rank correlation; order statistics; robust estimates; Kolmogorov-Smirnov test; nonparametric curve estimation.

reviews.author: 二汪
reviews.title: Useful statistical course
reviews.comment_content: Mainly about distribution-free models. For statistics and fina math students, it may be quite useful for your capstone project. It introduces topics like Wilcoxon sign rank test, Mann-Whitney U test, robust statistics, etc. Some of the methods are developed by prof himself, so try not to skip lessons. The content is easy anyway.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Highly recommend NOT to skip lessons.

I kinda like the prof, he is really nice, though not good at teaching. He is willing to answer your questions, but you may not understand his explaining. This course involves a bunch of proofs during the lessons. And the MOST important thing is, the proofs in the notes are NOT complete!!!! You have to listen to his explanation (though I felt like those are some dirty proofs). I wrote down the whole proof from the lecture notes in the final exam, and the TA said the proof is not complete, without telling me what the answer should be, and deduced half of marks for the question!
reviews.comment_grading:
It takes attendance since the add-drop period is ended.
I believe it is a good grading course. I got overall above mean 1 mark, and got a straight B.

Item (Weighting): My marks/Base marks(Mean)
Homework 1-4 (15%): 390/400 (373.06)
Midterm (35%): 55/80 (62.03)
Final (50%): 74/100 (66.29)
Attendance (Bonus 2%): 0.8/2 (1.22)
Total: 76.49% (75.49%)

One important thing: DO NOT make any single mistake in the exam. The TA had deduced 20 marks for my midterm just because I got two wrong answers with correct steps (minus 10 per question). She simply ignored all the step you have written, and looked at your answer straightly.
reviews.comment_workload: You only get 4-5 assignments which are super easy to handle.

reviews.author: calcguy
reviews.title: Useless Statistics Course
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 1: Introduction to Nonparametric Statistics
Chapter 2: Sign test and Wilcoxon's Signed Rank Test
Chapter 3: Wilcoxon Rank Sum Test
Chapter 4: Rank Method for One-way Layout
Chapter 5: Rank Method for Linear Regression and Correlation
Chapter 6: Goodness of Fit Test
Chapter 7: Order Statistics
Chapter 8: Robust Statistics
reviews.comment_teaching:
In my opinion, his teaching is quite crap.
* His way of teaching: Just reading out contents from power point. All theorems from lecture notes are proved in-class. But the main problem is with his intonation and handwriting style; his English is not so good, so I can hardly understand what he's talking about. Also, I found his handwriting to be very hard to be read. So, in the end, I have to rely on other sources of learning to understand all the chapters.
* Teaching pace: Very very slow. All details from lecture notes are explained, which is actually good, but then the problem is with his intonation and handwriting. Oh, one more thing, no lecture video before classes were cancelled.
* Tutorials: Very useful, but it's your choice to attend it. I myself find it quite useful, but tutorial notes are emailed to us only few days before the exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
- 4 Assignments: 15%
Mean for each assignment:
* Assignment 1: 94.58
* Assignment 2: 96.02
* Assignment 3: 98.62
* Assignment 4: 93.29
- 1 Midterm: 35%
Mean: 43.51/70
- 1 Final Exam (Online): 50%
Mean: 82.2/100
- Bonus Attendance: 2%
Mean: 1.73/2

Comments:
1. Assignments 1-3 contain 3 questions each, quite straight forward; follow tutorial notes and lecture notes closely. Deadlines are one week after the release of each assignment.
2. Assignment 4 is assigned after the classes were cancelled. It contains 7 questions (so f**king many) and only 5 days is given to complete it. In addition, each question is quite tedious, adding pain to us.
3. The midterm exam is not so hard, but definitely not easy. It contains 4 questions and we are given 80 minutes to finish it. You are allowed (and definitely necessary) to bring any tables into the exam (e.g. U table and Wilcoxon T-table). Coverage of exam is from Sign Test to Location Shift Model (Chapter 2 to 3).
4. There is 1 proof question in the midterm.
5. Final exam is non-cumulative. Coverage from Chapter 4 to Chapter 8. Feel free to see the questions in the attachment. The questions are given out via email at around 11:55 AM, and you need to submit the solution via email before 5 PM.

reviews.author: Robertgao
reviews.comment_content:
This course is quite useful for those students who are interesting in statistics. It mainly focus on concept, unlike 2411 which focus on computation.

However, if your grade of math2411 is below B, i highly recommend you DO NOT take this course. Because before mid term, it relates to different kinds of test.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is really funny and full of bean. He makes the lesson very funny and u never have a chance to fall a sleep.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is quite small since it just give you a few assignment which are not difficult.
